intro: Chrysophyllum laurentii var. lundense, commonly known as the African star apple, is a tropical evergreen tree native to West Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The tree produces edible, star-shaped fruits that are rich in vitamins and minerals. Its botanical features include a dense canopy, smooth bark, and a tendency to grow in moist, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of nutritious fruit.
